original_title: The Many Ways To Play Colossal Cave Adventure After Nearly Half a Century
original_content:
Born from a passion for caving and the wish to turn this into a digital adventure for all ages, Colossal Cave Adventure has grown from its quiet introduction in 1976 by William Crowther into the expanded game that inspired countless others to develop their own take on the genre, eventually leading to the realistically rendered graphical adventures we can play today. Yet even Colossal Cave Adventure has recently got a refresh in the form of a 3D graphical version, which has led [Bryan Lunduke] to take a look at how to best revisit the original text adventure.
Your Colossal Cave Adventure awaits (Credit: Bryan Lunduke)
For those who are on Linux or a BSD system, the easiest way is to hop over to the package manager and install Colossal Cave Adventure straight away with the package bsdgames on Debian-based systems, or colossal-cave-adventure on others. A port by Eric S. Raymond of the 1995 version of the game can also be found as Open Adventure, and theres a 1990-era DOS version you can experience on real hardware or even in a browser window, if thats your thing. Or get it for your Amiga, Macintosh or OS/2. These days you can even get ready-to-use maps of the entire cave and surroundings, which along with walkthroughs can make things far too easy.
As for the newly released version of the game, its available on the usual store outlets, including GoG, and reviews of the game do seem to appreciate that it is essentially a like-for-like translation of the texture adventure into a graphical one. As for whether a nearly-half-a-century old game holds up to scrutiny by sticking to what worked when Dungeons  Dragons was still the new kid on the block and systems like the PDP-10 ruled the roost, this is very much debatable, but one has to have respect for a game that has stuck around for so long, across so many system architectures and programming languages. Plus it also gave us Zork.
(Thanks to [Stephen Walters] for the tip)
title: 「巨大な洞窟の冒険」の新バージョンは3Dグラフィックで登場
body: 1976年にWilliam Crowtherによって静かに導入されたColossal Cave Adventureは、デジタル冒険に変えることを望む洞窟探検の情熱から生まれました。これが一部の人々に影響を与え、結果として現在プレイしている現実的なグラフィカルな冒険ゲームが開発されました。最近では3Dグラフィック版も登場しました。オリジナルのテキストアドベンチャーゲームを再訪するために、Bryan Lundukeがどのようにするか見てみました。
